definition: to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)

sentences.english: The United States and other nations did nothing to deserve or invite this threat.
sentences.chinese: 這個針對美國和其他國家的威脅是沒來由的。

sentences.english: Sometimes I'm tired and miserable for no reason at all.
sentences.chinese: 有時候，我就是沒來由地覺得疲憊和痛苦。

sentences.english: When I think about you, I smile for no reason ;
sentences.chinese: 想到你啊，就會沒來由的笑。

sentences.english: Discovery chance after supporting rebels is now no longer unreasonably high.
sentences.chinese: 支持亂黨的發現機率，不會再沒來由地高。
靜靜地等待，沒來由的無奈。

sentences.english: There is no reason to assume that Luciano sired the ruling Syndicate Commission idea either.
sentences.chinese: 沒來由以爲播下盧西亞諾在朝辛迪加委員會概念。

sentences.english: Although it is just a joke, but I feel cold opening speaker at.
sentences.chinese: 雖然是玩笑話，但我沒來由的感覺到冷。

sentences.english: Excessive fear, for example, generates panic or chronic anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 例如，過度恐懼導致沒來由或慢性的焦慮。

sentences.english: Indians are always negative on others and positive (even without due justifications) on themselves.
sentences.chinese: 三哥總是沒來由地唱衰別人捧高自己。
